docs.title: Open-PAV
docs.text: Open-PAV (Open Product Automated Vehicle) is an open platform designed to facilitate data collection, model calibration, and simulation of producted automated vehicle behaviors. It integrates diverse datasets and calibrated vehicle models, making it an essential tool for researchers and developers aiming to study product automated vehicle (PAV) dynamics and their impacts. The project encourages contributions from the research community and provides ready-to-use model parameters for seamless integration with simulation tools.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
Comprehensive Dataset

  • Collects and organizes data from PAVs, including LiDAR, images, videos, and trajectory data.
  • Provides datasets in a unified vectorized format for efficient access and analysis.

Kinematic Model Calibration

  • Supports linear models, IDM models (for SUMO), Wiedemann-99 (for Vissim), and machine learning-based models.
  • Includes pre-configured model parameters for direct use in traditional simulation software.

Simulation Integration

  • Enables rapid and accurate simulation of automated vehicle behavior and analysis of their impacts.

Community Collaboration

  • Designed to foster contributions and collaboration among researchers globally.

docs.title: What's New
docs.text:
March 2025

  • Model Enhancements: Improved calibration modeling methodology.
  • Simulation Integration: Configured packages for SUMO, Vissim, and basic parameters for models.

December 2024

  • Dataset Expansion: Added new open-source trajectory datasets from ULTRA datasets.
  • Model Enhancements: Improved basic logic for the project.

November 2024

  • Project Startup: Comprehensive installation and user guides are now available.

docs.title: Major Components
docs.text:
• Data Repository: A unified storage of diverse datasets (LiDAR, images, videos, trajectories).
  • Model Calibration Tools: Utilities to calibrate vehicle kinematic models and export them for simulation.
  • Simulation Integration: Pre-configured packages for SUMO, Vissim, and other platforms.
  • Scenario Manager: Tools to create and manage simulation scenarios based on real-world data.

For more details, refer to the Open-PAV Documentation.

docs.title: Installation Guide
docs.text:
Follow these steps to install Open-PAV:

  1. Clone the Repository: Use Git to clone the Open-PAV GitHub repository.

```bash git clone https://github.com/MarkMaaaaa/OpenPAV.git

docs.title: Model Calibration
docs.text: Open-PAV provides tools for calibrating various vehicle kinematic models:

docs.title: Supported Models
docs.text:
• Linear Models: Suitable for basic simulations.
  • IDM Models: Ideal for SUMO simulations.
  • Wiedemann-99: Compatible with Vissim.
  • Machine Learning-Based Models: For advanced simulations.

docs.title: Calibration Steps
docs.text:
1. Data Input: Load your collected data into the calibration tool.
  2. Parameter Adjustment: Adjust model parameters to fit the data.
  3. Validation: Validate the calibrated model against a test dataset.
  4. Export: Export the calibrated parameters for simulation use.

For detailed calibration procedures, refer to the Developer Guide.

docs.title: Vehicle and Model Selection
docs.text:
Use the form below to select your vehicle and algorithm model. The generated file will be available for download.

Select Vehicle Model: --Select-- Tesla Audi Benz Select Algorithm Model: --Select-- Intelligent Driver Model (IDM) Linear Model Machine Learning Model Select Parameter File Type: --Select-- Original Parameters Vissim Parameters SUMO Parameters Generate and Download

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
Get started with Open-PAV by following these steps:

  1. Installation: Ensure Open-PAV is installed on your system. Refer to the Installation Guide for instructions.

  2. Data Preparation: Prepare your datasets (LiDAR, images, videos, trajectories) and place them in the appropriate directories.

  3. Model Selection: Choose the desired vehicle model (e.g., Tesla, Audi, Benz) and the corresponding kinematic model (e.g., IDM, linear model, machine learning model).

  4. Model Calibration: Use the provided tools to calibrate the selected model with your data.

  5. Simulation Integration: Export the calibrated model parameters and integrate them into your preferred simulation platform (e.g., SUMO, Vissim).

For more detailed instructions, consult the User Guide.

docs.title: Simulation Integration
docs.text: Integrate Open-PAV with various simulation platforms to simulate automated vehicle behaviors:

docs.title: Supported Platforms
docs.text:
• SUMO: Use IDM models with pre-configured parameters.
  • Vissim: Utilize Wiedemann-99 models for accurate simulations.
  • Other Platforms: Custom integration supported via exported model parameters.

docs.title: Integration Steps
docs.text:
1. Model Calibration: Ensure your vehicle model is calibrated. Refer to the Model Calibration Guide.
  2. Parameter Export: Export the calibrated parameters in the required format (e.g., original parameters, Vissim parameter file, SUMO parameter file).
  3. Simulation Setup: Import the parameters into your simulation platform.
  4. Execution: Run the simulation to analyze vehicle behaviors.

For comprehensive integration instructions, see the Developer Guide.
